kszucs commented on issue #5875: ARROW-7116: [CI] Use the docker repository provided by apache organization
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5875#issuecomment-556080267
 
 
   Seems like the secrets are not available on Ptrs from 3rdparty repositories: https://github.com/apache/arrow/runs/311985541#step:6:1
   
   I've pushed this change to my fork's master with incorrect credentials set up. The secrets are indeed available and the push is rejected as expected: https://github.com/kszucs/arrow/runs/312031223#step:6:17
   
   In order to test that the pushes are working properly, we need to merge this PR. Master won't fail no matter whether the secrets are available or not: https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/.github/workflows/cpp.yml#L52
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #5875: ARROW-7116: [CI] Use the docker repository provided by apache organization
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5875#issuecomment-557316475
 
 
   I'm trying to understand why we need to introduce ASF INFRA into the loop of managing our development Docker images (versus a DockerHub organization that is managed directly by Arrow PMC members). Is this a convenience or is there another reason?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on issue #5875: ARROW-7116: [CI] Use the docker repository provided by apache organization
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5875#issuecomment-557338176
 
 
   Apache Arrow PMC members can't set secret variables to this repository. ASF INFRA only can do it.
   If we can't set secret variables, we can't push updated Docker images automatically by GitHub Actions.
   
   We can use https://hub.docker.com/u/arrowdev instead of  https://hub.docker.com/r/apache/arrow-dev but we need to ask to ASF INFRA to set secret variables
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description: This is required to push the outdated, but rebuilt images from GitHub actions for reuse.
fields.summary: [CI] Use the docker repository provided by apache organisation

comments.body:
How about using GitHub Package Registry?
https://help.github.com/en/github/managing-packages-with-github-package-registry/configuring-docker-for-use-with-github-package-registry

We can push to there by the provided {{GITHUB_TOKEN}}.
Note that we can't use {{GITHUB_TOKEN}} on {{pull_request}} event because it's read only. We can use {{GITHUB_TOKEN}} on {{push}} event.

[~kou] I've tried the GitHub package registry a couple weeks ago, but it was failing with errors indicating misconfigured docker registry. On long term I'd favour to switch, but simply put it wasn't working last time I checked.
I understand. Thanks for the information!

Hmm, do we really want to be tied to the ASF for this as well?

Looking at https://hub.docker.com/r/apache/arrow-dev , it seems my account (pitrou) does not have write access...
Otherwise we'd need to grant access for the apache members and ask infra to set the dockerhub credentials of a user who has write access to our current GitHub organization.
I don't quite understand this issue. Why does GHA require using a particular DockerHub organization?

[~wesm] I've renamed the issue, it was originally "[CI] Ask INFRA to set up the DOCKERHUB_* secrets for GitHub actions"

The conversation actually in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/INFRA-19429
